conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C and D. Predict which container (E, F or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
A, B, C, and D are the starting points of the liquid.
E, F, and G are the containers that receive the liquid.
Stream A, B, and C strikes the blue slanted barrier and is deflected to the left.
Stream D hits the grey slanted barrier and is deflected to the right.
Stream A, B, and C mix up and hug the left wall and flow straight down.
Stream C splits another thin branch drops and strikes the black baffle.
Stream D runs along the grey baffle and then hugs the right wall and flows straight down.

premise: Stream A, B, and C mix up and hug the left wall and flow straight down.
conclusion: Most mixture of A, B, and C end in container E.

premise: Stream C splits another thin branch drops and strikes the black baffle.
conclusion: The other thin stream of C ends in container F.

premise: Stream D runs along the grey baffle and then hugs the right wall and flows straight down.
conclusion: Stream D ends in container G.
